question.questionText: Johnny drove to the store with his father one cold and rainy night. They had only driven a short distance when the windows "fogged up" on the inside. What was it about the windows that caused the "fog" to form on them?

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: The windows were cooler than the water vapor in the air, causing the vapor to condense.

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: The windows in the car were cold because it was cold outside. There was lots of water vapor in the car, so it stuck to the cold windows and changed into condensation water.
They were cold and since Johnny probably turned the heat on the water vapor would turn into water again and settle onto the windows.
